SourcedStatement: The U.S. Army was making 14,000 artillery shells a month prior to the conflict. Now, officials at the plant told Morning Edition that the army is producing 36,000 shells a month, up from 24,000 just six months ago.
Name: U.S. Army
Justification: Providing production data on artillery shells for context

SourcedStatement: The Biden administration announced this month it would be sending an additional $250 million dollars worth of new military aid to Ukraine, including air defense missiles and 155mm howitzer rounds.
Name: The Biden Administration
Justification: Informing on recent military aid package to Ukraine

SourcedStatement: The Tobyhanna Army Depot, which specializes in logistics support and radar equipment for foreign allies such as Ukraine, estimates that the company has a $2.4 billion dollar impact on the area and that it is the largest industrial employer in the region.
Name: Tobyhanna Army Depot
Justification: Highlighting economic impact and role in the region

SourcedStatement: Lockheed Martin and other military contractors... have become a vital part of the economy of Northeastern Pennsylvania.
Name: Lockheed Martin
Justification: Illustrating contribution to the regional economy

SourcedStatement: We’re all about quality jobs, and that’s a quality organization. So the infusion of additional funding to support is important to us.
Name: Bob Durkin
Title: President and Chief Executive Officer of the Scranton Chamber of Commerce
Justification: Representing the interests of the Scranton Chamber of Commerce

SourcedStatement: It’s not $277 million that stays here. But, you know, it’s a good chunk of it. And it’s important that we keep that work coming.
Name: Matt Cartwright
Title: Congressman, House Appropriations Committee
Justification: Representing Scranton and Northeastern Pennsylvania, providing insight on economic impact

SourcedStatement: I don’t really think that people dwell or concentrate on anything that’s going on outside of their sphere of influence. We’re kind of busy concentrating on what’s going on in Scranton.
Name: Rich Hansen
Title: Commander’s Representative at the Scranton Army Ammunition Plant

SourcedStatement: With the Ukraine support, you know, one day I was sitting there thinking about what needs to be done, and it kind of hit me that what we were doing directly affects whether people live or die. If we aren’t doing our job correctly, people could die tomorrow. And that just put this whole thing in perspective for me.
Name: Jim Jarick
Title: Senior Technology Center Engineer at the Tobyhanna Army Depot
Justification: Sharing personal insight into the impact of work on Ukraine

SourcedStatement: At the height of last year’s counteroffensive, the Ukrainians were firing about 6,000 a day. The Russians are [firing] probably about 10,000 a day.
Name: Mark Cancian
Title: Senior Advisor at the Center for Strategic and International Studies
Justification: Providing expert analysis on Ukraine-Russia conflict dynamics

SourcedStatement: Our first task is to save our people. Without artillery, we cannot do this.
Name: Col. Olksandr Popov
Title: Commander of a Ukrainian Artillery Unit
Justification: Highlighting Ukraine’s need for artillery support

SourcedStatement: We had a job fair in the middle of a heat wave and there was still a line going out of the door. We had another one when it was pouring rain, and the same thing happened.
Name: Job Fair Attendees
Justification: Illustrating demand for jobs at Tobyhanna Army Depot
